text:
“I fancied you could tell us something,” Raskolnikov said.  
“I quite muddled it.”  
“Then you should be more careful,” Razumihin replied grimly.  
Porfiry Petro-vitch saw them out with excessive politeness.  
They stepped into the street, gloomy and sullen.  
Silence hung between them.  
Raskolnikov drew a deep breath.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov and Razumihin leave a conversation with a sense of gloom and silence.
